message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with natural language processing (NLP) tasks, specifically relevance matching between short and long text pairs, which is critical to problems like query-document matching in information retrieval and web searching. This suggests that the paper could belong to the sub-categories of Computational Linguistics (cs.CL) or Information Retrieval (cs.IR). 

The paper proposes a novel approach using graph attention networks to extract structural information from long documents, which falls under the sub-category of Machine Learning (cs.LG) and Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI). 

Finally, the paper also discusses the limitations of existing deep models for short-long text matching, which could be relevant to the sub-category of Social and Information Networks (cs.SI) that deals with network analysis and modeling.
